c70bff97-5cbd-4759-9e4e-b3e156cf949e.description: The BPS Board Certified Pharmacotherapy Specialist (BCPS) program is a credential for pharmacists who have met the eligibility criteria below and who in their unique practice ensure the safe, appropriate, and economical use of medications as part of interprofessional treatment teams in a variety of settings, including hospitals and health systems.
c70bff97-5cbd-4759-9e4e-b3e156cf949e.name: Board Certified Pharmacotherapy Specialist

issuer.summary: issued by Board of Pharmacy Specialties

badge_template_activities.title: Graduation from a pharmacy program accredited by the Accreditation Council for Pharmacy Education (ACPE) or a program outside the U.S. that qualifies the individual to practice in the jurisdiction
A current, active license to practice pharmacy in the U.S. or another jurisdiction

Completion of three (3) years of practice experience (post-pharmacist licensure) with at least 50% of time spent in pharmacotherapy activities as defined by the Pharmacotherapy Content Outline, or complete a PGY-1 residency
Achieving a passing score on the Pharmacotherapy Specialty Certification Examination

337f6679-09b5-4130-900d-d194216e942f.description: The BPS Board Certified Ambulatory Care Pharmacist (BCACP) Program is a credential for pharmacists who have met the eligibility and provide integrated, accessible healthcare services for ambulatory patients in a wide variety of settings. The BCACP provides patient care, develops sustained partnerships with ambulatory patients and other healthcare providers in the context of family and community; and integrates care of both acute illnesses and chronic conditions.
337f6679-09b5-4130-900d-d194216e942f.name: Board Certified Ambulatory Care Pharmacist

issuer.summary: issued by Board of Pharmacy Specialties

badge_template_activities.title: Graduation from a pharmacy program accredited by the Accreditation Council for Pharmacy Education (ACPE) or a program outside the U.S. that qualifies the individual to practice in the jurisdiction
A current, active license to practice pharmacy in the U.S. or another jurisdiction

At least four years of practice experience post-pharmacist licensure with at least 50% of time spent in ambulatory care pharmacy activities as defined by the Ambulatory Care Pharmacy Content Outline, or a PGY-1 residency plus at least two years of practice experience post-pharmacist licensure with at least 50% of time spent in ambulatory care pharmacy activities as defined by the Ambulatory Care Pharmacy Content Outline, or a specialty PGY-2 residency in ambulatory care pharmacy
Achieving a passing score on the Ambulatory Care Pharmacy Specialty Certification Examination

137688cd-71fe-4e04-ab19-0375668b5106.description: Geriatric Pharmacy Practice specializes in applying the knowledge of pharmacodynamics and pharmacokinetics of medications in older adults to optimize therapeutic outcomes. The BPS Board Certified Geriatric Pharmacist (BCGP) program is a credential for pharmacists who have met the eligibility criteria and who in their unique practice provides pharmaceutical care to the elderly, including wellness, treatment, monitoring and patient safety services.
137688cd-71fe-4e04-ab19-0375668b5106.name: Board Certified Geriatric Pharmacist

issuer.summary: issued by Board of Pharmacy Specialties

badge_template_activities.title: Graduation from a pharmacy program accredited by the Accreditation Council for Pharmacy Education (ACPE) or a program outside the U.S. that qualifies the individual to practice in the jurisdiction.
A current, active license to practice pharmacy in the U.S. or another jurisdiction.

At least four years of practice experience post-pharmacist licensure with at least 50% of time spent in geriatric pharmacy activities as defined by the Geriatric Pharmacy Content Outline, or PGY-1 residency plus at least two years of practice experience post-pharmacist licensure with at least 50% of time spent in geriatric pharmacy activities as defined in the BPS Geriatric Pharmacy Content Outline, or a specialty PGY-2 residency in geriatric pharmacy.
Achieving a passing score on the Geriatric Pharmacy Specialty Certification Examination.

d2da817f-f141-4a58-b0cb-0316e34ec408.description: The BPS Board Certified Critical Care Pharmacist (BCCCP) program is a credential for pharmacists who have met the eligibility criteria below and specialize in the delivery of patient care services as integral members of interprofessional teams, working to ensure the safe and effective use of medications in critically ill patients.
d2da817f-f141-4a58-b0cb-0316e34ec408.name: Board Certified Critical Care Pharmacist

issuer.summary: issued by Board of Pharmacy Specialties

badge_template_activities.title: Graduation from a pharmacy program accredited by the Accreditation Council for Pharmacy Education (ACPE) or a program outside the U.S. that qualifies the individual to practice in the jurisdiction
A current, active license to practice pharmacy in the U.S. or another jurisdiction

Completion of 4 years of practice experience (post-pharmacist licensure) with at least 50% of time spent in critical care pharmacy activities as defined by the Critical Care Pharmacy Content Outline, or a PGY-1 residency plus 2 additional years of practice experience (post-pharmacist licensure) with at least 50% of time spent in critical care pharmacy activities as defined by the Critical Care Pharmacy Content Outline, or a specialty (PGY-2) residency in critical care pharmacy
Achieving a passing score on the Critical Care Pharmacy Specialty Certification Examination

24a7c3dd-978d-4d81-890f-f648a8f199f4.description: The BPS Board Certified Oncology Pharmacist (BCOP) program is a credential for pharmacists who have met the eligibility criteria below and who in their unique practice, involving an increasing number and complexity of drug therapies for treating and preventing cancer, manage cancer-related and drug-related adverse events or clinical situations not encountered in other disease states.
24a7c3dd-978d-4d81-890f-f648a8f199f4.name: Board Certified Oncology Pharmacist

issuer.summary: issued by Board of Pharmacy Specialties

badge_template_activities.title: Graduation from a pharmacy program accredited by the Accreditation Council for Pharmacy Education (ACPE) or a program outside the U.S. that qualifies the individual to practice in the jurisdiction
A current, active license to practice pharmacy in the U.S. or another jurisdiction

Completion of four (4) years of practice experience (post-pharmacist licensure) with at least 50% of time spent in oncology pharmacy activities as defined by the Oncology Pharmacy Content Outline, or a PGY-1 residency plus two (2) additional years of practice experience (post-pharmacist licensure) with at least 50% of time spent in oncology pharmacy activities as defined by the Oncology Pharmacy Content Outline, or a specialty residency in oncology pharmacy
Achieving a passing score on the Oncology Pharmacy Specialty Certification Examination

c7555194-d96c-4213-923b-4b951192f2c6.description: The BPS Board Certified Infectious Diseases Pharmacist. (BCIDP) program is a credential for pharmacists who have met the eligibility criteria and who in their unique practice specialize in the use of microbiology and pharmacology to develop, implement and monitor drug regimens that incorporate the pharmacodynamics and pharmacokinetics of antimicrobials to optimize therapy for patients.
c7555194-d96c-4213-923b-4b951192f2c6.name: Board Certified Infectious Diseases Pharmacist

issuer.summary: issued by Board of Pharmacy Specialties

badge_template_activities.title: Graduation from a pharmacy program accredited by the Accreditation Council for Pharmacy Education (ACPE) or a program outside the U.S. that qualifies the individual to practice in the jurisdiction
A current, active license to practice pharmacy in the U.S. or another jurisdiction

Completion of four (4) years of practice experience post-pharmacist licensure with at least 50% of time spent in infectious diseases pharmacy activities as defined by the ID Pharmacy Content Outline, or a PGY-1 residency plus two (2) additional years of practice experience post-pharmacist licensure with at least 50% of time spent in infectious diseases pharmacy activities as defined by the ID Pharmacy Content Outline, or a specialty PGY-2 residency in ID pharmacy
Achieving a passing score on the Infectious Diseases Pharmacy Specialty Certification Examination

eac75398-c17b-4df5-a512-a5a8472879f8.description: The BPS Board Certified Sterile Compounding Pharmacist (BCSCP) Program is a credential for pharmacists who have met the eligibility criteria and who in their unique practice are responsible for ensuring that sterile preparations meet the clinical needs of patients, satisfying quality, safety, and environmental control requirements in all phases of preparation, storage, transportation, and administration in compliance with established standards, regulations, and professional best practices.
eac75398-c17b-4df5-a512-a5a8472879f8.name: Board Certified Sterile Compounding Pharmacist

issuer.summary: issued by Board of Pharmacy Specialties

badge_template_activities.title: Graduation from a pharmacy program accredited by the Accreditation Council for Pharmacy Education (ACPE) or program outside the U.S. that qualifies the individual to practice in the jurisdiction
A current, active license to practice pharmacy in the U.S. or another jurisdiction

Completion of 4,000 hours of post licensure/registration practice experience in compounded sterile preparations pharmacy. The 4,000 hours of experience required may be earned in a variety of settings. ASHP-accredited residencies that include practice hours in the activities listed in the Compounded Sterile Preparations Content Outline will be accepted as practice experience on an hour-for-hour basis.
Achieving a passing score on the Compounded Sterile Preparations Specialty Certification Examination

c5b49f29-8b3d-4988-ac73-f126578436bc.description: The BPS Board Certified Pediatric Pharmacy Specialist® (BCPPS) program is a credential for pharmacists who have met the eligibility criteria below and who in their unique practice ensure safe and effective drug use and optimal medication therapy outcomes in patients up to 18 years of age.
c5b49f29-8b3d-4988-ac73-f126578436bc.name: Board Certified Pediatric Pharmacy Specialist

issuer.summary: issued by Board of Pharmacy Specialties

badge_template_activities.title: Graduation from a pharmacy program accredited by the Accreditation Council for Pharmacy Education (ACPE) or a program outside the U.S. that qualifies the individual to practice in the jurisdiction
A current, active license to practice pharmacy in the U.S. or another jurisdiction

Completion of four (4) years of practice experience (post-pharmacist licensure) with at least 50% of time spent in pediatric pharmacy activities as defined by the Pediatric Pharmacy Content Outline, or a PGY-1 residency plus two (2) additional years of practice experience (post-pharmacist licensure) with at least 50% of time spent in pediatric pharmacy activities as defined by the Pediatric Pharmacy Content Outline, or a specialty (PGY-2) residency in pediatric pharmacy
Achieving a passing score on the Pediatric Pharmacy Specialty Certification Examination

7b2722e8-3f7f-4ace-bf48-0b2fb449f17a.description: The BPS Board Certified Psychiatric Pharmacist (BCPP) program is a credential for pharmacists who have met the eligibility criteria below and who in their unique practice provide person-centered care that ensures the safe, appropriate, evidence-based, and cost-effective use of medications in the treatment of persons with mental illness.
7b2722e8-3f7f-4ace-bf48-0b2fb449f17a.name: Board Certified Psychiatric Pharmacist

issuer.summary: issued by Board of Pharmacy Specialties

badge_template_activities.title: Graduation from a pharmacy program accredited by the Accreditation Council for Pharmacy Education (ACPE) or a program outside the U.S. that qualifies the individual to practice in the jurisdiction
A current, active license to practice pharmacy in the U.S. or another jurisdiction

Completion of four (4) years of practice experience (post-pharmacist licensure) with at least 50% of time spent in psychiatric pharmacy activities as defined by the Psychiatric Pharmacy Content Outline, or a PGY-1 residency plus two (2) additional years of practice experience (post-pharmacist licensure) with at least 50% of time spent in psychiatric pharmacy activities as defined by the Psychiatric Pharmacy Content Outline, or a specialty (PGY-2) residency in psychiatric pharmacy
Achieving a passing score on the Psychiatric Pharmacy Specialty Certification Examination

f2a70466-628f-4612-acfb-43f87e7aca4d.description: The BPS Board Certified Nutrition Support Pharmacist (BCNSP) program is a credential for pharmacists who have met the eligibility criteria below and who in their unique practice address the care of patients receiving specialized nutrition support, including parenteral (IV) or enteral (feeding tube) nutrition.
f2a70466-628f-4612-acfb-43f87e7aca4d.name: Board Certified Nutrition Support Pharmacist

issuer.summary: issued by Board of Pharmacy Specialties

badge_template_activities.title: Graduation from a pharmacy program accredited by the Accreditation Council for Pharmacy Education (ACPE) or a program outside the U.S. that qualifies the individual to practice in the jurisdiction
A current, active license to practice pharmacy in the U.S. or another jurisdiction

Completion of three (3) years of practice experience (post-pharmacist licensure) with at least 50% of time spent in nutrition support pharmacy activities as defined by the Nutrition Support Pharmacy Content Outline, or a a (PGY-2) residency in nutrition support pharmacy
Achieving a passing score on the Nutrition Support Pharmacy Specialty Certification Examination

4e37d5df-6503-4c91-9040-25201395316d.description: The BPS Board Certified Cardiology Pharmacist (BCCP) program is a credential for pharmacists who have met the eligibility criteria below and specialize in the delivery of direct patient care, as members of interprofessional health care teams, working to ensure safe and effective use of medications in patients with cardiovascular disease.
4e37d5df-6503-4c91-9040-25201395316d.name: Board Certified Cardiology Pharmacist

issuer.summary: issued by Board of Pharmacy Specialties

badge_template_activities.title: Graduation from a pharmacy program accredited by the Accreditation Council for Pharmacy Education (ACPE) or a program outside the U.S. that qualifies the individual to practice in the jurisdiction
A current, active license to practice pharmacy in the U.S. or another jurisdiction

Completion of four (4) years of practice experience post-pharmacist licensure with at least 50% of time spent in cardiology pharmacy activities as defined by the Cardiology Pharmacy Content Outline, or a PGY-1 residency plus two (2) additional years of practice experience post-pharmacist licensure with at least 50% of time spent in cardiology pharmacy activities as defined by the Cardiology Pharmacy Content Outline, or a specialty PGY-2 residency in cardiology pharmacy
Achieving a passing score on the Cardiology Pharmacy Specialty Certification Examination

a7280e88-41a6-4d0f-9bb5-89cb8304335e.description: The BPS Board Certified Transplant Pharmacist (BCTXP) Program is a credential for pharmacists who have met the eligibility criteria below and specialize in the delivery of direct patient care, as members of interprofessional health care teams, working to ensure safe and effective use of medications for patients throughout all phases of solid organ transplantation.
a7280e88-41a6-4d0f-9bb5-89cb8304335e.name: Board Certified Transplant Pharmacist

issuer.summary: issued by Board of Pharmacy Specialties

badge_template_activities.title: Graduation from a pharmacy program accredited by the Accreditation Council for Pharmacy Education (ACPE) or program outside the U.S. that qualifies the individual to practice in the jurisdiction
A current, active license to practice pharmacy in the U.S. or another jurisdiction

Completion of four (4) years of practice experience post-pharmacist licensure with at least 50% of time spent practicing in the domains described in the Solid Organ Transplantation (SOT) Pharmacy Content Outline, or a PGY-1 residency plus two (2) additional year of practice experience post-pharmacist licensure with at least 50% of time spent practicing in the domains described in the SOT Pharmacy Content Outline, or a specialty PGY-2 residency in Solid Organ Transplantation Pharmacy
Achieving a passing score on the Solid Organ Transplantation Specialty Certification Examination

e755fb87-50e5-4e4e-842d-1f42b39ee9fd.description: The BPS Board Certified Nuclear Pharmacist® (BCNP) program is a credential for pharmacists who have met the eligibility criteria below and who in their unique practice seek to improve and promote public health through the safe and effective use of radioactive drugs for diagnosis and therapy.
e755fb87-50e5-4e4e-842d-1f42b39ee9fd.name: Board Certified Nuclear Pharmacist

issuer.summary: issued by Board of Pharmacy Specialties

badge_template_activities.title: Graduation from a pharmacy program accredited by the Accreditation Council for Pharmacy Education (ACPE) or a program outside the U.S. that qualifies the individual to practice in the jurisdiction (Foreign trained pharmacists must pass the Foreign Pharmacy Graduate Examination Committee (FPGEC) examination.)
A current, active license to practice pharmacy in the U.S. or another jurisdiction
Completion 4,000 hours of training/experience in nuclear pharmacy practice
Achieving a passing score on the Nuclear Pharmacy Specialty Certification Examination

36eca4df-e747-4471-8d0e-70a7b0e4bca5.description: The BPS Ambassador program showcases BPS Board-Certified pharmacists who are advancing practice in their communities, improving patient care, and educating the next generation of pharmacists. The BPS Ambassadors will highlight the value of BPS Board Certification and its impact on their career, through improvements in patient care, interprofessional teams, employer perception, professional development, or career advancement.
36eca4df-e747-4471-8d0e-70a7b0e4bca5.name: 2021-2023 BPS Ambassador

issuer.summary: issued by Board of Pharmacy Specialties

badge_template_activities.title: Ambassadors must hold active certification through the Board of Pharmacy Specialties.
Ambassadors must complete BPS media and communications training.

c110cf53-8d44-4f1b-a212-bc818e41fd87.description: The BPS Ambassador program showcases BPS Board-Certified pharmacists who are advancing practice in their communities, improving patient care, and educating the next generation of pharmacists. The BPS Ambassadors will highlight the value of BPS Board Certification and its impact on their career, through improvements in patient care, interprofessional teams, employer perception, professional development, or career advancement.
c110cf53-8d44-4f1b-a212-bc818e41fd87.name: 2022-2024 BPS Ambassador

issuer.summary: issued by Board of Pharmacy Specialties

badge_template_activities.title: Ambassadors must hold active certification through the Board of Pharmacy Specialties.
Ambassadors must complete BPS media and communications training.

536de1e7-0520-4782-a5db-e17afb1878be.description: The BPS Ambassador program showcases BPS Board-Certified pharmacists who are advancing practice in their communities, improving patient care, and educating the next generation of pharmacists. The BPS Ambassadors will highlight the value of BPS Board Certification and its impact on their career, through improvements in patient care, interprofessional teams, employer perception, professional development, or career advancement.
536de1e7-0520-4782-a5db-e17afb1878be.name: 2023-2025 BPS Ambassador

issuer.summary: issued by Board of Pharmacy Specialties

badge_template_activities.title: Ambassadors must hold active certification through the Board of Pharmacy Specialties.
Ambassadors must complete BPS media and communications training.

a4b7341a-0565-4fc8-a6df-dfad830d0b8e.description: The BPS Board Certified Emergency Medicine Pharmacist (BCEMP) program is a credential for pharmacists who have met the eligibility criteria below and specialize in the care for patients at the bedside across diverse populations and acuity levels. Their practice is focused to optimize pharmacotherapy, improve patient safety, increase efficiency and cost-effectiveness of care, facilitate medication stewardship, educate patients and other healthcare providers, and contribute to scholarly efforts.
a4b7341a-0565-4fc8-a6df-dfad830d0b8e.name: Board Certified Emergency Medicine Pharmacist

issuer.summary: issued by Board of Pharmacy Specialties

badge_template_activities.title: Graduation from a pharmacy program accredited by the Accreditation Council for Pharmacy Education (ACPE) or program outside the U.S. that qualifies the individual to practice in the jurisdiction
A current, active license to practice pharmacy in the U.S. or another jurisdiction

Completion of four (4) years of practice experience post-pharmacist licensure with at least 50% of time spent practicing in the domains described in the Emergency Medicine Pharmacy Content Outline, or a PGY-1 residency plus two (2) additional year of practice experience post-pharmacist licensure with at least 50% of time spent practicing in the domains described in the Emergency Medicine Pharmacy Content Outline, or a specialty PGY-2 residency in Emergency Medicine Pharmacy
Achieving a passing score on the Emergency Medicine Pharmacy Specialty Certification Examination
